metadata.title: CVE-2023-52682 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: f2fs:fix to wait on block writeback for post_read case If inode is compressed,but not encrypted, it missed to call f2fs_wait_on_block_writeback() to waitfor GCed page writeback in IPU write path. Thread A GC-Thread - f2fs_gc -do_garbage_collect - gc_data_segment - move_data_block -f2fs_submit_page_write migrate normal cluster's block via meta_inode's pagecache - f2fs_write_single_data_page - f2fs_do_write_data_page -f2fs_inplace_write_data - f2fs_submit_page_bio IRQ - f2fs_read_end_io IRQold data overrides new data due to out-of-order GC and common IO. -f2fs_read_end_io

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52682` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic - 6.8.0-11.11
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-11-generic-64k - 6.8.0-11.11
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-aws - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-azure - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1002-gcp - 6.8.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-gke - 6.8.0-1003.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-ibm - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency - 6.8.0-7.7.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-7-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-7.7.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1001-oracle - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1001-raspi - 6.8.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1003-oem - 6.8.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-intel - 6.8.0-1001.6
No subscription required
